<meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>KS MOD Hack - Login</title> <style> @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Orbitron&display=swap'); * { margin: 0; padding: 0; box-sizing: border-box; font-family: 'Orbitron', sans-serif; } body { background: #010a16; display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; height: 100vh; overflow: hidden; } .login-container { background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8); padding: 40px; border-radius: 10px; text-align: center; box-shadow: 0 0 20px #00ff00; position: relative; overflow: hidden; } .login-container::before { content: ""; position: absolute; top: -50%; left: -50%; width: 200%; height: 200%; background: radial-gradient(circle, rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.2), transparent); animation: animate-glow 6s linear infinite; } @keyframes animate-glow { 0% { transform: rotate(0deg); } 100% { transform: rotate(360deg); } } h2 { color: #00ff00; font-size: 24px; margin-bottom: 20px; text-transform: uppercase; } .input-box { position: relative; margin-bottom: 20px; } .input-box input { width: 100%; padding: 12px; background: transparent; border: 2px solid #00ff00; outline: none; border-radius: 5px; font-size: 16px; color: #00ff00; } .input-box label { position: absolute; top: 50%; left: 12px; transform: translateY(-50%); color: #00ff00; pointer-events: none; transition: 0.3s ease; } .input-box input:focus ~ label, .input-box input:valid ~ label { top: 10px; font-size: 12px; } .btn { width: 100%; padding: 12px; background: #00ff00; color: #000; font-size: 16px; border: none; border-radius: 5px; cursor: pointer; transition: 0.3s; } .btn:hover { background: #009900; } .error { color: red; font-size: 14px; margin-top: 10px; display: none; } </style>

title: Gmail non mi fa uscire dal mio account
content:
Buongiorno,

Da ieri Gmail dopo l'accesso non mi fa più uscire dal mio account se uso l'app Firefox dal cellulare. In effetti non riesco neanche a uscire se uso l'app Gmail. Ci riesco comunque dal PC, per adesso. Dal cellulare dopo che "chiudo tutto" per accedere di nuovo devo comunque procedere come al solito. Cioè usare l'usuale processo; inserire la password. Non so se questo è veramente un problema oppure no.

Grazie mille, Ernesto Esposito

title: Redirected URLs are getting mangled on Linux Firefox desktop
content:
OS: Xubuntu 24.04.1 Firefox: All version for quite a long time up through version 135.

In general I have no problem with direct URLs loaded into Firefox, whether from local links or from remote sites.

However, sometimes, possibly as a result of an embedded link in an email, or from a site that pops-up a new instance of the default browser (i.e., Firefox), the URL is mangled with a local filesystem path prepended to the proper URL. The path seems to be one that Firefox accessed in the recent past. For example, a path such as: /usr/local/bin

When the browser starts up, The URL field will show: /usr/local/binhttps://.........

I then have to delete the leading path component before I can access the URL. I'd include a test case if I could find something repeatable that I could post here, but at the moment I don't have one.

Any ideas why this is happening and any suggestions for a way to stop it.

Thanks.
creator: quant

title: Not able to access some features
content: I have used Firefox for ages now and love it. I have noticed in the last few months that some functions on some web sites are not able to be accessed. Such as submit, place an order, and the like. I have to use another browser. Is there any reason for this as I really don't like to use any other browser other than Firefox but it seems to be that I have to. Is there some way that I can get around this?
